title: How to divorce if one spouse is living outside of US?
question: A friend of mine just found out heâ€™s not divorced several years ago in CA. He checked all the courts in his neighborhood and found nothing. He retained some legal service center then to file the divorce, but did not get anything. Apparently, he was defrauded.
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Serving divorce papers,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt
answers: He'll have to file for divorce in California, and serve overseas. A local divorce attorney can give him guidance as to the way a local court will treat the issue, but, generally, according to the State Department, service of process in Taiwan can be effected by international registered mail/return receipt requested; by agent, generally a local attorney; or pursuant to a letter rogatory. The attorney or agent can execute an affidavit of service before a travel officer at the American Institute in Taiwan (AIT). If enforcement of a judgment is anticipated, however, Taiwan may not consider service by registered mail or by agent acceptable and may require that service be effected pursuant to a letter rogatory
